intro: Madronella sanguinea, commonly known as the red madrona, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically dark green and glossy, and it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Madronella sanguinea is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks.
